before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"ahs59","text":"This protocol assumes you are using Benchling to manage your DNA and oligo sequences and to find Cas9 targets. Sign up for an account at https://benchling.com before getting started. (It's free for academic institutions!)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dune0","text":"The Yeast ORFan CURE is a project to \"knock out\" (disable) a bunch of yeast genes of unknown function. Doing so requires small synthetic pieces of DNA called \"oligonucleotides\" or \"oligos\". This protocol walks you through selecting a gene of unknown function and designing the oligonucleotides you'll need.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"11abj","text":"Please follow these directions very carefully -- even a single-\"letter\" mistake can be the difference between an experiment working and its failure!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cbfrq","text":"Now, choose any gene you want on the list. From the beginning or the middle or the end, it doesn't matter -- the list goes on for pages. {"blocks":[{"key":"89e6v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66mo1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2o1l9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58ua1","text":"In your project folder on Benchling, click the \"+\" button, choose \"Folder\", and create a folder named \"YFG\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elvmj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n3m7","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fp2jv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"felo2","text":"In the following directions, I will be using the abbreviation YFG to mean \"your favorite gene.\" Anywhere you see YFG, substitute the name of the gene you and your partner will be knocking out. Make sure that the \"Genome\" box reads \"R64-1-1 (sacCer3)\".  There are three things that you will need to change:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sr5r","text":"Change Upstream Bp to 1000","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eifom","text":"Change Downstream Bp to 1000","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42gqc","text":"Change Import As to your gene name","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"236fb","text":"Then click \"IMPORT\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1k6d","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"28kfg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F96D120001FA11EDAAD5B7BD81EDE4C7","height":310,"id":274671,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"oligos9.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inhtbvh6p.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inhrbvh6p.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inhsbvh6p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inhqbvh6p.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2rhue","text":"You will see the newly created document in its folder -- open it by clicking on it. You'll see the DNA sequence that we just imported -- lots of As, Cs, Ts and Gs. Next, we'll need to design a few pieces of synthetic DNA specifically for this sequence.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t3a4","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bbio1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"06F0B21001FB11EDAAD5B7BD81EDE4C7","height":444,"id":274675,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"oligos10.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inhxbvh6p.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inhvbvh6p.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inhwbvh6p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inhubvh6p.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bobqh","text":"In the \"Guide parameters\" box, you should only have to make one change. {"blocks":[{"key":"cn9no","text":"Now, it's time to choose exactly where you'll be disrupting your gene. Each \"flag\" has two colored numbers -- the left is the \"on-target\" score, and the right is the \"off-target\" score. We want to balance three things:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5g1m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d79uu","text":"We want the on-target score to be high -- over 70, if at all possible.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ohe5","text":"We want the off-target score to be low -- though in this example, they're all very similar.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a648m","text":"We want the location to be as far towards the beginning of the gene as possible -- in the first 1/3 of the gene, if at all possible.\n","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ik7","text":"You can also sort by the on-target score by clicking the \"On-Target Score\" column header. Then, when you click on the guide sequence on the right side of the screen, the corresponding portion of the gene will show up on the left.
